parts.title: Medicaid Expansion CHIP Program and Policy Changes

context_data.skip_text: Part 3 only applies to states with a Medicaid Expansion CHIP program. Please skip to Part 4.

parts.text: Indicate any changes you’ve made to your Medicaid Expansion CHIP program policies in the past federal fiscal year. Many changes listed in this section require a State Plan Amendment (SPA), while some don't, such as changing outreach efforts or changing the health plan enrollment process. Please submit a SPA to reflect any changes that do require a SPA.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the eligibility determination process?
Have you made any changes to the eligibility redetermination process?
Have you made any changes to the eligibility levels or target populations?
questions.hint: For example: increasing income eligibility levels.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the benefits available to enrollees?
questions.hint: For example: adding benefits or removing benefit limits.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the single streamlined application?
Have you made any changes to your outreach efforts?
questions.hint: For example: allotting more or less funding for outreach, or changing your target population.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the delivery system(s)?
questions.hint: For example: transitioning from Fee for Service to Managed Care for different Medicaid Expansion CHIP populations.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to your cost sharing requirements?
questions.hint: For example: changing amounts, populations, or the collection process.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the substitution of coverage policies?
questions.hint: For example: removing a waiting period.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the enrollment process for health plan selection?

context_data.bullet_text: Enrollment process for health plan selection

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the protections for applicants and enrollees?
questions.hint: For example: changing from the Medicaid Fair Hearing process to the review process used by all health insurance issuers statewide.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to premium assistance?
questions.hint: For example: adding premium assistance or changing the population that receives premium assistance.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the methods and procedures for preventing, investigating, or referring fraud or abuse cases?

context_data.bullet_text: Methods and procedures for prevention, investigation, and referral of cases of fraud and abuse

questions.label: Have you made any changes to eligibility for “lawfully residing” pregnant women?
Have you made any changes to eligibility for “lawfully residing” children?
Have you made changes to any other policy or program areas?

context_data.interactive_conditional: Show if any 2020-01-a-03 questions 1–16 has a yes answer, hide otherwise.
context_data.noninteractive_conditional: Show if any 2020-01-a-03 questions 1–16 has a yes answer, hide otherwise.

questions.label: Briefly describe why you made these changes to your Medicaid Expansion CHIP program.
Have you already submitted a State Plan Amendment (SPA) to reflect any changes that require a SPA?

parts.title: Separate CHIP Program and Policy Changes

context_data.skip_text: Part 4 only applies to states with a Separate CHIP program. Please skip to the next section.

parts.text: Indicate any changes you’ve made to your Separate CHIP program and policies in the past federal fiscal year. Many changes listed in this section require a State Plan Amendment (SPA), while some don't, such as changing outreach efforts or changing the health plan enrollment process. Please submit a SPA to reflect any changes that do require a SPA.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the eligibility determination process?
Have you made any changes to the eligibility redetermination process?
Have you made any changes to the eligibility levels or target populations?
questions.hint: For example: increasing income eligibility levels.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the benefits available to enrolees?
questions.hint: For example: adding benefits or removing benefit limits.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the single streamlined application?
Have you made any changes to your outreach efforts?
questions.hint: For example: allotting more or less funding for outreach, or changing your target population.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the delivery system(s)?
questions.hint: For example: transitioning from Fee for Service to Managed Care for different Separate CHIP populations.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to your cost sharing requirements?
questions.hint: For example: changing amounts, populations, or the collection process.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to substitution of coverage policies?
questions.hint: For example: removing a waiting period.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to an enrollment freeze and/or enrollment cap?
Have you made any changes to the enrollment process for health plan selection?

context_data.bullet_text: Enrollment process for health plan selection

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the protections for applicants and enrollees?
questions.hint: For example: changing from the Medicaid Fair Hearing process to the review process used by all health insurance issuers statewide.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to premium assistance?
questions.hint: For example: adding premium assistance or changing the population that receives premium assistance.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to the methods and procedures for preventing, investigating, or referring fraud or abuse cases?

context_data.bullet_text: Methods and procedures for prevention, investigation, and referral of cases of fraud and abuse

questions.label: Have you made any changes to your conception to birth expansion (as described in the October 2, 2002 final rule)?
questions.hint: For example: expanding eligibility or changing this population’s benefit package.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to your Pregnant Women State Plan expansion?
questions.hint: For example: expanding eligibility or changing this population’s benefit package.

questions.label: Have you made any changes to eligibility for “lawfully residing” pregnant women?
Have you made any changes to eligibility for “lawfully residing” children?
Have you made changes to any other policy or program areas?

context_data.interactive_conditional: Show if any 2020-01-a-04 questions 1–19 has a yes answer, hide otherwise.
context_data.noninteractive_conditional: Show if any 2020-01-a-04 questions 1–19 has a yes answer, hide otherwise.

questions.label: Briefly describe why you made these changes to your Separate CHIP program.
Have you already submitted a State Plan Amendment (SPA) to reflect any changes that require a SPA?
